item.content:encoded:
Imagine that we make the Earth a little bit smaller, oh no, that might make many problems such as even difficulties in breathing ( just refer to this documentary to find out what might happen)

Well lets just imagine in an imaginative way, lets travel to wonderland of Alice or lets imagine Anne Shirley holding a tea party in a spaceship.

For decreasing the gravity, we photograph everything upside down, agree? So prepare wires and hang all the dishes and chocolates.

Now time to do some splashing, it is fun. Use a syringe and splash. Splash and shoot them. You need high shutter speed. Choose the liquid according to the color of background, and light. I chose milk, but next time I want to choose a more dense liquid, may be milk mixed with gelatin or polyvinyl glue.

Just please take note that your settings in all of the photos should be the same, so do not set anything on automatic, choose everything such as white-balance, ISO, aperture, … manually, and the same for every shoot.

Next step would be compositing. Rotate photos by 180 degrees and composite all the splashes together. Now welcome your friends to your fantasy world.

item.content:encoded:
Your Question:

“How am I supposed to start a career in animations? I am confused about the softwares to learn. Blender vs Maya and blah blah. Please guide me.“

My Answer:

Hi, It’s very good that you think about that and you plan for what you want to do.

Yes there are many software and in fact software is just one aspect of it.

The process of finding the answer might take several months for you, but the magic will happen if you just research, write and think about it 20 minutes  each day 

My recommendation is two steps

  1. bring a notebook and write in it your goals in 1 month, 1 year, 5 year, 10 year Do you want to be an employee? freelance or make your own movies? do you want to be in process of production of an animated film? or motion graphics or ads? do you want to produce short animated films or long ones?
  2. research about
    1. different careers in animation studios, media production studios, Ads agencies.
    2. workflow of animation production / production pipeline
    3. famous films, ads, motion graphics, number of staff and years they took to produce 

Then based on these answers if you want to be “animator” you can choose what software to learn, if you want to be “modeler” the story differs , if you want to be compositor , that differs. If you want to be a freelancer or a single person making short films for festivals that also differ, and many much more other paths. But based on 1 and 2 you can answer them.

Wish you success
